Sentencas: The performance of reversible solid oxide electrochemical cells (R-SOECs) is largely hindered by the insufficient electroactivity and poor durability of the bifunctional air electrodes, where the oxygen reduction and evolution reactions (ORR and OER) occur.
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: Here, we report our findings in boosting the electrochemical activity and durability of an air electrode with Pr0.2Ba0.2Sr0.2La0.2Ca0.2CoO3-d (PBSLCC) via an A-site entropy engineering.
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: The PBSLCC electrode shows enhanced oxygen reaction activity and excellent durability compared to binary and ternary double perovskites (PrBaCo2O5+d and Pr0.8Ba0.8- Ca0.4Co2O5+d, respectively).
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: A low and nearly unchanged area-specific resistance of 0.042 X cm2 is achieved at 750 degrees C during the 225-h stability test.
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: La0.8Sr0.2Ga0.8Mg0.2O3-d electrolyte-supported cells with the PBSLCC air electrode show remarkable performance at 800 degrees C, demonstrating a peak power density of 1.2 W cm-2 in the fuel cell mode, and a current density of-1.1
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: A cm-2 at 1.3 V in the electrolysis mode while maintaining the excellent cycling durability of 228 h at +/- 0.5 A cm-2 under humidified H2 (10% H2O).
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: A bulk oxygen p-band center model is applied to verify that tailoring of the A-site entropy strongly influences the surface exchange coefficients (k*chem), leading to higher oxygen reaction activity of PBSLCC than the binary and ternary perovskites.
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering

Sentencas: This study opens a new class of high-entropy perovskites for the rational design of air electrodes for R-SOECs with high activity and durability.
Titulo: A reversible perovskite air electrode for active and durable oxygen reduction and evolution reactions via the A-site entropy engineering
